title: Nationwide Assessment of the Ghana School Feeding Programme
challenge: Government needed an evidence-based assessment of GSFP to unlock additional financing and improve programme delivery.
approach: Led a World Bank–supported nationwide assessment covering 16 regions; engaged MMDA officials, head teachers, caterers, and beneficiary households; synthesized operational, financial, and nutrition data to produce recommendations for scale-up.
outcomes: Assessment report produced with prioritized reform roadmap

title: Boosting Green Employment and Enterprise Opportunities (GrEEn)
challenge: Youth unemployment and limited green enterprise capacity constrained local livelihoods.
approach: Served as Project Manager supporting SNV and UNCDF to coordinate MSME coaching, green jobs fairs, and municipality-level enterprise enablement with MLGRD and MELR.
outcomes: Coordinated delivery of enterprise coaching cohorts
Linked MSMEs to municipal opportunity pipelines
Improved local government support to green entrepreneurship

title: National Clean Cooking Strategy Task Team
challenge: High reliance on polluting fuels caused health and environmental burdens.
approach: Served on national task team drafting a Clean Cooking Strategy; aligned targets with health, environment and gender outcomes; mapped financing and market enablers.
outcomes: Stakeholder inputs consolidated for policy finalization

title: SISTARS Organisational Development for Women in STEM Leadership
challenge: Institutional barriers limited women’s progression into leadership in STEM-focused organisations.
approach: Facilitated OD plans for four organisations (GWCL, CBAS, UG-WRI, CONIWAS), focusing on governance, inclusive policies, and leadership pipelines.
outcomes: Leadership pipeline actions identified per institution
Baseline gender metrics defined for tracking
kpis: Gender policy updates drafted per institution

title: NAFAG Governance Strengthening & Elections Support
challenge: The National Fisheries Association required constitutional updates and credible governance processes.
approach: Facilitated OD programme for NAFAG, drafted constitution updates, and led processes culminating in board elections.

title: Sustainable Fisheries Management Project (SFMP) – Partner OD
location: Western, Central & Greater Accra Regions, Ghana
challenge: Partner CSOs needed stronger systems to influence fisheries governance and deliver programmes.
approach: Led capacity assessments and OD for 9 partners; developed SOPs, strategic and advocacy plans; trained boards and staff.
outcomes: 9 partner assessments and OD plans completed
Board and staff trained in governance & leadership
Administrative, financial, and OD manuals delivered

title: Anti-Child Labour & Trafficking Community Messaging
challenge: Child labour and trafficking risks required tailored local messaging and duty-bearer coordination.
approach: Facilitated development of anti-child labour and human trafficking messages with 10 District Assemblies; aligned with protection services.
outcomes: Referral pathways clarified with social welfare units

title: Water & Sanitation Social Enterprise Setup
challenge: A deprived community lacked affordable, reliable water and sanitation services.
approach: Supported the establishment of a social enterprise to provide community water points and sanitation services; created jobs and service protocols.
outcomes: Enterprise operationalized with basic service menu
Local employment created for youth and women

title: Integrated School Project on Clean Cookstoves & Fuels
challenge: Schools relied on inefficient cooking practices, impacting health and budgets.
approach: Supported World Education International and the Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves; co-developed a clean cooking manual for GES curriculum integration.

title: Green Economy Strategy Manual & MMDA Training
challenge: MMDAs needed practical guidance to mainstream green economy principles in Medium-Term Development Plans.
approach: Co-developed national strategy manual and handbook; trained district planners to integrate green economy into MTDPs.
outcomes: National manual and trainer handbook delivered

title: SPEFA – Social Public Expenditure & Financial Accountability
challenge: Limited citizen oversight and understanding of public financial management processes.
approach: Managed nationwide social accountability project with 30 CSOs; trained stakeholders and organised town halls to engage duty bearers.
outcomes: PFM literacy improved among citizen groups
Regular town halls institutionalized in MMAs

title: National Climate Change Adaptation & DRR Mainstreaming
challenge: Climate risks were not consistently integrated into national and district plans.
approach: Contributed to Ghana’s National Climate Change Adaptation Strategy and co-facilitated training for 10 pilot districts on mainstreaming Climate Change and Disaster Risk Reduction.
outcomes: Policy briefs on climate for Ghana produced
